sentences.english: In the eyes of the servants, Councillor Zhang is an amiable person.
sentences.chinese: 在下人们的眼中，张员外是个和善的人。

sentences.english: Then WangShiChong came to the house of water agents, the spot will kill water agents.
sentences.chinese: 随后王世充来到了水员外的家中，当场将水员外杀死。

sentences.english: Then WangShiChong came to the house of water agents, the spot will kill water agents.
sentences.chinese: 随后王世充来到了水员外的家中，当场将水员外杀死。

sentences.english: Your money is far too little for the landlord.
sentences.chinese: 你的这点儿小钱王员外根本看不上眼。

sentences.english: But the landlord had already accepted the proposal of the young master surnamed Ma, a son of a rich family.
sentences.chinese: 可祝员外早已把女儿许配给了有钱人家的少爷马公子。

sentences.english: The old WuPing Listen to process wso say, swim "dragon was immediately allow down to help."
sentences.chinese: 听程员外这么一说，游伯龙当即就容许下来情愿帮助。

definition: (dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
prefectural magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
county magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
sir (respectful form of address for an old man)
official registrar (of a county etc) in imperial China
